item.title: Chance and the Curse of Statistical Thinking
item.description: Based on Peter Thiel’s 2013 SXSW Lecture: “You Are Not A Lottery Ticket” 1 Imagine a tennis match. There are two players, whose biomechanics are well understood, the courtâ€™s surface, the physical properties of which are known, a ball, which exhibits predictable comportment, and two rackets about which all conceivable questions have been answered. Could a sage observer predict the outcome of the match? Anyone who claims to be able to predict such events with definite accuracy is, rightfully, branded delusional.

item.title: Chance and the Curse of Statistical Thinking
Peter Thiel : Philosopher or Entrepreneur?
item.description: An essay on the philosophy of Peter Thiel.
